messageBody:
Interesting. Please print out and post the entire stack trace here. I
wonder if it's because the JUnit custom classloader has loaded something
that throws the exception.

The only other silly thing I can think of right off is that the java
that's first in your PATH isn't the one you think it is. Do a java
-version just to be sure.

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: frank_silbermann [mailto:fs@...]
> Sent: Monday, July 22, 2002 1:13 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JUnit and jre\lib\ext
>
>
> I am using the JDK 1.4 with JUnit 3.7, and I have installed the
> jdom.jar into the jre\lib\ext folder.
>
> For some reason JUnit is not able to find the JDOM classes unless I
> explicitly add the jdom.jar to the classpath. I am getting an error
> of the form: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/jdom/JDOMException
>
> Why does JUnit not seem to be using the .jar files added to my
> jre\lib\ext folder?
>
> (I know I am not supposed to put the junit.jar in jre\lib\ext, but
> why not jdom.jar? I have already added the jdom classes to the
> excluded properties list, and in any case it fails even when it's the
> first test I run after starting JUnit.)
